Package com.stickycoding.Rokon

Class Summary
Accelerometer An interface to manage the Accelerometer sensor Allows the game to extend AccelerometerHandler and manage events triggered by changes or shakes.
AudioStream Handles a stream of sound, launched through RokonAudio.
Background This is a frame for backgrounds to be built from
Collider  
Constants  
Debug Handles LogCat output, and timing events for testing
DynamicObject  
Emitter The emitter is the spawning point for particles, much work is still needed to be done here
Font  
Hotspot Hotspot class is used as a way of simplying the detection of touches on the screen, and triggers onHotspotTouched
Layer A Layer contains your visible objects, Text, Sprites and Emitters.
Particle Represents a Particle inside an Emitter system
ParticleModifier  
Polygon  
RenderHook RenderHook's give you the ability to access, and modify OpenGL directly.
Rokon  
RokonActivity  
RokonAudio This is optimized for short sound files, which must be played quickly such as sound effects in games.
RokonMusic RokonMusic plays one sound file, continuously or otherwise.
Shape  
SoundFile SoundFile contains sounds which have been loaded into the RokonAudio class.
Sprite Sprite handles both visual and physical parts of in game objects.
SpriteModifier SpriteModifier allows repetive changes to the Sprite to be applied across many Sprites with minimal code.
Text Text is an object which can be added to Layer's that will draw text using TTF fonts loaded into the Font class.
Texture Representative of each image, can exist without being loaded onto the hardware
TextureAtlas  
TextureBuffer A holder for the a Texture buffer, easier way of handling the ByteBuffer
TextureManager  
TextureOptions  
TextureType  
TrackingSprite A sprite which attaches itsself to a parent and follows that location with an offset
Transition Transitions allow the appearance of basic changes between scenes.
Vector  
Vertex  
VertexBuffer An easier way of managing a ByteBuffer for vertices
